stk.ga.ga_exit module¶

Defines functions which cut short the GA if a condition is satisfied.

These functions are useful when debugging and testing the convergence of the GA. For example they can tell the GA to stop when a certain molecule has been found.

The functions are defined as methods in the Exit.

Extending stk: Adding exit functions.¶

The only requirement is that the methods take population as their first argument (barring self, cls etc.) and progress as their second. They must return True if the exit criterion has been satisfied and False otherwise. The naming requirement of the first two arguments exists to help users identify which arguments they need to define in the input file and which are handeled automatically by stk. The arguments population and progress are automatically provided when the GA is run. They hold a GAPopulation instance holding the current generation and a GAPopulation instance holding every previous generation in a subpopulation, respectively.

As usual, if you need to define multiple functions, make sure any helper functions are private, i.e. their names start with a leading underscore.

class stk.ga.ga_exit.Exit(func_data)¶

Bases: object

Checks if the exit criterion for the GA has been satisfied.

func_data¶

A FunctionData object which holds the name of the exit function to use and any additional parameters it may require.

Type:FunctionData
fitness_plateau(population, progress, num_gens, top_members=1)¶

Checks if the most fit molecules remain the same.

Parameters:
  • pop (GAPopulation) – The population holding the current generation of molecules.
  • progress (GAPopulation) – A population where every previous generation is a subpopulation.
  • num_gens (int) – Number of generations in which the fittest molecules did not change.
  • top_members (int, optional) – The number of fittest molecules which are checked. This number needs to be smaller than the population size.
Returns:

True if the fitness function shows no improvement for n generations.
Return type:

bool
mol_name_present(population, progress, mol_name)¶

Looks for a molecule called mol_name.

Parameters:
  • pop (GAPopulation) – The population holding the current generation of molecules.
  • progress (GAPopulation) – A population where every previous generation is a subpopulation.
  • mol_name (str) – The name of a molecule.
Returns:

True if a molecule with MacroMolecule.name of mol_name is found in population. Else, False.
Return type:

bool
mol_present(population, progress, mol)¶

True if mol is in population.

Parameters:
  • pop (GAPopulation) – The population holding the current generation of molecules.
  • progress (GAPopulation) – A population where every previous generation is a subpopulation.
  • mol (MacroMolecule) – A molecule which if present in population causes the GA to stop.
Returns:

True if mol in population, False otherwise.
Return type:

bool
no_exit(population, progress)¶

Returns False.

Useful when you never want the GA to exit prematurely.

Parameters:
  • pop (GAPopulation) – The population holding the current generation of molecules.
  • progress (GAPopulation) – A population where every previous generation is a subpopulation.
Returns:

False
Return type:

bool
